chain.description:
The workshop will be held in Singapore. The five largest cities within a 50 km radius of the venue are Singapore, Woodlands, Johor Bahru, Batam, and Pasir Gudang. Here are their details:

1. Singapore:
   - Population: 3,547,809
   - Distance from workshop venue: 7,721.13 km
   - Country: Singapore

2. Woodlands:
   - Population: 252,530
   - Distance from workshop venue: 10,165.20 km
   - Country: Singapore

3. Johor Bahru:
   - Population: 802,489
   - Distance from workshop venue: 14,382.49 km
   - Country: Malaysia

4. Batam:
   - Population: Unknown
   - Distance from workshop venue: Unknown
   - Country: Indonesia

5. Pasir Gudang:
   - Population: Unknown
   - Distance from workshop venue: Unknown
   - Country: Malaysia

The local timezone for Singapore is Asia/Singapore. The current local time in Singapore is 11:35:48 PM.

Finish

function.name: getlargestcities_for_reverse_geocoding_and_geolocation_service
function.description: This is the subfunction for tool "reverse_geocoding_and_geolocation_service", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "Returns 5 largest cities within a given radial range with name, population, country and distance."

function.name: getnearestcities_for_reverse_geocoding_and_geolocation_service
function.description: This is the subfunction for tool "reverse_geocoding_and_geolocation_service", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "Returns a readable place name as nearest 3 cities with population, country and distance based on given latitude/longitude pair."

range.description: max radial range for lookup in meter (0=no range)

function.name: gettimezone_for_reverse_geocoding_and_geolocation_service
function.description: This is the subfunction for tool "reverse_geocoding_and_geolocation_service", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "Finds the local timezone for any given geo-location point by lat and long and returns timezone information with Timezone name, Timezone id and current local time."

function.name: reversegeocode_for_trueway_geocoding
function.description: This is the subfunction for tool "trueway_geocoding", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "Obtain address for location"

location.description: The location for which you wish to obtain the human-readable address

language.description: The language in which to return results

function.name: geocode_for_trueway_geocoding
function.description: This is the subfunction for tool "trueway_geocoding", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "Obtain geocoordinates for address"

address.description: The address that you want to geocode

language.description: The language in which to return results

function.name: place_distance_for_geodb_cities
function.description: This is the subfunction for tool "geodb_cities", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "Gets this place's distance to the given place."

distanceunit.description: The unit of distance: KM | MI [default]

function.name: city_distance_for_geodb_cities
function.description: This is the subfunction for tool "geodb_cities", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "Gets the distance to the given city."

cityid.description: The city id (either native id or wikiDataId)

distanceunit.description: The unit of distance: KM | MI [default]

function.name: country_places_for_geodb_cities
function.description: This is the subfunction for tool "geodb_cities", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "Get the places in the given country."

limit.description: The maximum number of results to retrieve

offset.description: The zero-ary offset into the results

maxpopulation.description: Only places having no more than this population

types.description: Only cities for these types (comma-delimited): ADM2 | CITY | ISLAND

sort.description: How to sort the results. Format: ±SORT_FIELD,±SORT_FIELD where SORT_FIELD =  elevation | name | population

nameprefixdefaultlangresults.description: When name-prefix matching, whether or not to match on names in the default language if a non-default language is requested

includedeleted.description: Whether to include any cities marked deleted: ALL | SINCE_YESTERDAY | SINCE_LAST_WEEK | NONE

minpopulation.description: Only places having at least this population

nameprefix.description: Only places whose names start with this prefix. If languageCode is set, the prefix will be matched on the name as it appears in that language.

function.name: Finish
function.description: If you believe that you have obtained a result that can answer the task, please call this function to provide the final answer. Alternatively, if you recognize that you are unable to proceed with the task in the current state, call this function to restart. Remember: you must ALWAYS call this function at the end of your attempt, and the only part that will be shown to the user is the final answer, so it should contain sufficient information.

final_answer.description: The final answer you want to give the user. You should have this field if "return_type"=="give_answer"

train_messages.content:
You are AutoGPT, you can use many tools(functions) to do the following task.
First I will give you the task description, and your task start.
At each step, you need to give your thought to analyze the status now and what to do next, with a function call to actually excute your step.
After the call, you will get the call result, and you are now in a new state.
Then you will analyze your status now, then decide what to do next...
After many (Thought-call) pairs, you finally perform the task, then you can give your finial answer.
Remember: 
1.the state change is irreversible, you can't go back to one of the former state, if you want to restart the task, say "I give up and restart".
2.All the thought is short, at most in 5 sentence.
3.You can do more then one trys, so if your plan is to continusly try some conditions, you can do one of the conditions per try.
Let's Begin!
Task description: You should use functions to help handle the real time user querys. Remember:
1.ALWAYS call "Finish" function at the end of the task. And the final answer should contain enough information to show to the user,If you can't handle the task, or you find that function calls always fail(the function is not valid now), use function Finish->give_up_and_restart.
2.Do not use origin tool names, use only subfunctions' names.
You have access of the following tools:
1.reverse_geocoding_and_geolocation_service: Find nearest or largest city information or timezone for any given point location (latitude/longitude). The reverse geocode API back "reverse" codes any GPS location point into nearest or largest readable places with county, city, distance and population.
2.trueway_geocoding: Forward and Reverse Geocoding
3.geodb_cities: Get global city, region, and country data. Filter and display results in multiple languages.
